member.summary: Disconnects the client if it's connected and swaps out the transport it's using.

member.remarks: This method does not automatically reconnect to the server. To continue communicating with the server, will need to be called again.

member.name: M:Riptide.Client.Connect(System.String,System.Byte,Riptide.Message)
member.summary: Attempts to connect to the given host address.
member.param: The host address to connect to.
The ID of the group of message handler methods to use when building .
A message containing data that should be sent to the server with the connection attempt. Use to get an empty message instance.
member.remarks:
Riptide's default transport expects the host address to consist of an IP and port, separated by a colon. For example: 127.0.0.1:7777.
If you are using a different transport, check the relevant documentation for what information it requires in the host address.
member.returns: if the was in a valid format; otherwise .

member.name: F:Riptide.DisconnectReason.timedOut
member.summary: For when a client's connection times out. This also acts as the fallback reasonâ€”if a client disconnects and the message containing the real reason is lost in transmission, it can't be resent as the connection will have already been closed. As a result, the other end will time out the connection after a short period of time and this will be used as the reason.

member.name: T:Riptide.Message
member.summary: Provides functionality for converting data to bytes and vice versa.

member.name: F:Riptide.Message.HeaderSize
member.summary: The number of bytes required for a message's header.
member.remarks: 1 byte for the actual header; 2 bytes for the message ID. NOTE: Various transports may add additional bytes when sending messages, so this value may not reflect the true size of the header that is actually sent. For example, Riptide's default RUDP transport inserts an extra 2 bytes for the message's sequence ID when sending reliable messages, but this is not (and should not be) reflected in this value.

member.name: P:Riptide.Message.MaxSize
member.summary: The maximum number of bytes that a message can contain, including the .

member.name: P:Riptide.Message.MaxPayloadSize
member.summary: The maximum number of bytes of payload data that a message can contain. This value represents how many bytes can be added to a message on top of the .

member.name: P:Riptide.Message.InstancesPerSocket

member.remarks: Changes will not affect and instances which are already running until they are restarted.

member.name: T:Riptide.Transports.Extensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for the class which are required by transport-related code but unnecessary in (and generally unintended for) everyday use of Riptide.
member.remarks: Exposing these publicly as part of the class would make them accessible and show up in intellisense wherever the namespace is used. By making them extension methods housed in the namespace, usage requires explicitly referencing said namespace, which should help avoid most cases of users accidentally using these methods simply because they are accessible and show up in intellisense.

member.name: P:Riptide.Transports.IServer.AllowAutoMessageRelay
member.summary: Whether or not to allow messages to be automatically sent to all other connected clients.
member.remarks: This should never be enabled if you want to maintain server authority, as it theoretically allows hacked clients to tell your instance to automatically distribute any message to other clients. However, it's extremely handy when building client-authoritative games where the instance acts mostly as a relay and is directly forwarding most messages to other clients anyways.
